items: Start by lying on your back with your arms extended towards the ceiling and your legs straight up in the air.
Slowly lower your right arm and left leg towards the ground, keeping them straight and hovering just above the floor.
Return to the starting position and repeat with your left arm and right leg.
Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Make sure to keep your lower back pressed into the ground and engage your core throughout the exercise.
Strengthens the core muscles, including the rectus abdominis, obliques, and transverse abdominis
Helps to prevent lower back pain by strengthening the muscles that support the spine
Increases flexibility in the hamstrings and hip flexors
Can be modified for different fitness levels and abilities
